Navigation
Name Rascal/Patterns/Abstract
Synopsis Abstract patterns.
Syntax
Pattern Syntax
Literal Boolean, Integer, Real, Number, String, Location, or DateTime
Variable declaration Type Var
Multi-variable Var*
Variable Var
List [ Pat1, Pat2, ..., Patn ]
Set { Pat1, Pat2, ..., Patn }
Tuple < Pat1, Pat2, ..., Patn >
Node Name ( Pat1, Pat2, ..., Patn )
Descendant / Pat
Labelled Var : Pat
TypedLabelled Type Var : Pat
TypeConstrained [Type] Pat
Details Literal VariableDeclaration MultiVariable Variable List Set Tuple Node Descendant Labelled TypedLabelled TypeConstrained
Description An abstract pattern is recursively defined and may contain the following elements:
  • Literal: Literal in abstract pattern.
  • VariableDeclaration: Variable declaration in abstract pattern.
  • MultiVariable: Multi-variable in abstract pattern.
  • Variable: Variable in abstract pattern.
  • List: List in abstract pattern.
  • Set: Set in abstract pattern.
  • Tuple: Tuple in abstract pattern.
  • Node: Node in abstract pattern.
  • Descendant: Deep match in an abstract pattern.
  • Labelled: Labelled abstract pattern.
  • TypedLabelled: Typed, labelled, abstract pattern.
  • TypeConstrained: Type constrained abstract pattern.
Pitfalls Map patterns are not (yet?) supported.
